#Text=John of Cologne
#Text=This article is about the Dominican friar and saint , John of Cologne .
#Text=For the Gothic architect of the same name , see Juan de Colonia .
#Text=John of Cologne , O.P.
#Text=( Joannes van Hoornaar ) , was a friar and priest of the Dominican Order , born in the Electorate of Cologne , part of modern Germany .
#Text=He later became a parish priest of Hoornaar , in the Spanish Netherlands .
#Text=He was executed for his faith in 1572 and has been declared a martyr and saint by the Catholic Church .
#Text=Background
#Text=In the period 1550-1560 the Dutch Provinces were trying to gain their independence from the Spanish empire of King Philip II .
#Text=The Geuzen ( Sea Beggars ) were adventurers , pirates and patriots who fought against the Spanish rule in the Dutch provinces .

#Text=For several years their bases of operation included the ports of Emden ( on the coast of the Dutch Province Friesland ) , La Rochelle ( on the coast of France ) and Dover ( on the coast of England ) .
#Text=The Sea Beggars attacked vessels of almost any nation as well as fishing villages and towns on the coast of the Dutch Provinces . [ 1 ]
#Text=Life
#Text=All that is known of John 's early life is that he attended the University of Cologne , then recognized as one of the best educational institutions in Europe .
#Text=He entered the Dominican Order at Cologne and received his formation there .
#Text=After completing his education , John was assigned to a parish in the Netherlands village of Hoornaar , where he served for the next twenty years . [ 2 ]
#Text=By 1572 , Lutheranism and Calvinism had spread through a great part of Europe .
#Text=In the Netherlands this was followed by a struggle between the two denominations in which Calvinism was victorious .
#Text=On 1 April of that year Calvinists and a group called the Watergeuzen ( Sea Beggars ) conquered Brielle ( Den Briel ) and later Flushing . [ 1 ]
#Text=In June of that year , Dordrecht and Gorkum also fell into their hands .
#Text=There they arrested all the Catholic clergy and held them in confinement , in an attempt to get them to deny the Catholic beliefs on the Eucharist and papal primacy . [ 3 ]
#Text=As John became aware of what had happened to his fellow priests , he disguised himself and attempted to bring them the comfort of the sacraments .
#Text=He secretly ministered to the captives but was eventually found out and also taken captive .
#Text=These nineteen were imprisoned in Gorkum from June 26 until July 6 , undergoing much abuse . [ 2 ]
#Text=Meanwhile , a letter from William the Silent , Prince of Orange , enjoined all those in authority to leave priests and religious unmolested .
#Text=Nevertheless Lumey , the commander of the Watergeuzen , ordered them to be hanged on the night of 9 July , [ 2 ] in a turfshed , after cruel tortures .
#Text=They are referred by the Roman Catholic Church as the Martyrs of Gorkum . [ 3 ]
#Text=The group was canonized by Pope Pius IX in 1867 .
#Text=Their remains are honored at a shrine built to their honor in Brielle .
